page.title: 03FARMING IN THE PEWSEY VALE
page.content: Overproduction of cereals nationally has encouraged cereal farmers to experiment with other crops such as oilseed rape, peas and beans. A recent innovation to the area is the growing of potatoes as a 'break' crop. The potatoes are often 'Record' variety, grown specifically for the Crisp market. Agriculture still provides the best opportunity for employment in the area, but much less so than formerly. As a consequence, cottages occupied by former farm workers are increasingly being sold off as week-end retreats or retirement homes.
